TEXT: The first applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE in Ajab - Shahr , GPE . He is currently living in GPE , GPE , with his wife ( the second applicant ) and their CARDINAL children ( the remaining applicants ) . His wife and children are all NORP nationals . The family are subject to a deportation order under which they are to be expelled to GPE . The applicants are represented before the ORG by ORG in collaboration with ORG , both GPE - based organisations .
The facts , as presented by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .

The first applicant was an activist in the NORP People Fedaee Guerrillas ( IPFG ) , a NORP - Leninist organisation , and had taken part in the DATE uprising against GPE . ORG ’s opposition to the NORP government installed after the uprising led to the organisation being banned and its members arrested and executed .

In DATE or DATE , the applicant was shot and wounded in the leg when trying to evade an arrest operation carried out by the NORP security forces against opponents of the regime . He was subsequently detained without trial for DATE in a prison in the town of GPE . The first applicant claims that during his detention he was severely and frequently tortured in order to compel him to confess to his illegal political activities , including by means of mock executions and beatings . He was given a summary trial and sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . Following his release in DATE , he moved to GPE where he lived under another name and continued his activities in the IPFG . He married the second applicant who had been involved in a branch of the ORG and had been arrested in DATE along with her brother . Their CARDINAL children were born DATE . The family had to change addresses frequently because of fear of arrest .
Fearing that the authorities would discover his true identity and whereabouts and that he would be arrested and tortured again , the first applicant determined to flee GPE with his family .

The applicant ’s wife and children entered GPE legally on DATE . On DATE she was interviewed by the NORP branch of ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( ORG ) . On DATE the family was granted a temporary residence permit by the NORP authorities with instructions to reside in the town of ORG . On DATE the second applicant was notified by the ORG that her asylum claim had been rejected and was subsequently served with a deportation order by the NORP authorities . Following her appeal against the execution of the order , the authorities agreed on DATE to extend the family ’s residence permit for DATE .

On DATE the first applicant entered GPE illegally and on DATE he lodged a request with the GPE office of the ORG for political refugee status . At his interview , which was conducted in the absence of an interpreter , he maintained that he was a member of the ORG and was wanted by the NORP authorities .

The applicant was subsequently interviewed by the NORP authorities , again without the assistance of an interpreter , and was granted a temporary residence permit with instructions to live in the NORP - NORP border town of GPE . On DATE the authorities authorised the first applicant to join his family in ORG for a period of DATE and he moved there the following day .

On DATE the ORG interviewed the first and second applicants separately . The second applicant alone was provided with an interpreter . On DATE the ORG rejected their asylum claims and considered that they were on that account ineligible for resettlement in a third country .
ORG appealed successfully to the ORG in DATE to reconsider the first applicant ’s case , which they did . However their decision remained unchanged .

On DATE ORG served a deportation notice on the first applicant ordering him and his family to leave GPE within DATE . On DATE the applicant requested the authorities to review their decision . Having regard to the fact that the Commission had acceded to the first applicant ’s request for interim measures under Rule CARDINAL of its Rules of Procedures , the validity of the family ’s residence permit was extended to DATE . ORG declared the first applicant ’s application inadmissible on DATE .
On DATE ORG ordered the applicant and his family to leave GPE . The applicants were informed of this decision on DATE .
On DATE the applicants contested this decision . On DATE ORG rejected their appeal and instructed the ORG police to have the applicants escorted to the border .

On DATE the applicants filed proceedings before ORG , requesting a stay in the execution of the expulsion decision . On DATE the court , on the basis of the dossier submitted by the applicants , rejected their request .

Following his request to ORG , the first applicant was examined by a panel of doctors . According to the applicants , the doctors found that the first applicant had behavioural symptoms which were consistent with his claim that he had been ill - treated when in detention .
